result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel T Salter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail today, July 15, 2022, to submit DNA sample.

Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel T Salter

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

11:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samuel T Salter in court.  Attorney Joel David Schlitz in court for Samuel T Salter. 
COVERS 22CF54, 22TR247, 22TR248, 22TR251, 22TR255 & 22TR589.

22CF54 
Count 1 - State moves to amend to Simple Possession of THC 961.41(3g)(e).  Court grants amendment.  Guilty plea entered.
State moves to ADD Count 2 - Simple Possession of THC 961.41(3g)(e).  Court grants amendment.  Guilty plea entered.

22TR251 - Guilty plea entered.
22TR247, 22TR248, 22TR255 & 22TR589 - Dismissed


The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty. State relates.  Attorney Schlitz relates. Defendant relates. Court relates and orders:

22CF54 - Counts 1 & 2
Costs including DNA surcharge with 60 DTP
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County today, Friday July 15, 2022 to submit DNA sample.

22TR251 - OWI 1st - BAC .149
$811.50 forfeiture with 60 DTP
6 months DL Revocation
AODA

10:00 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samuel T Salter in court.  Attorney Joel David Schlitz in court for Samuel T Salter. 
THIS COVERS 22CF54, 22TR247, 22TR248, 22TR251, 22TR255, 22TR589
22CF54 - Formal reading of Information waived. Not guilty pleas entered. 
22TR589 - Not guilty plea entered. 

Court resets files. Must appear in person.
Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:00 PM Defendant Samuel T Salter in court.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Joel David Schlitz in court for Samuel T Salter. 
COVERS 22CF54, 22TR247, 22TR248, 22TR251, 22TR255.
State relates on waiver of preliminary hearing.  Attorney Schlitz relates on waiver of preliminary hearing and presents waiver to the court  Court questions Defendant.  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given, finds probable cause, and binds over for trial.  Arraignment set for 06/03/2022 at 10:00 a.m. before Judge Babler.  MUST APPEAR IN PERSON. Citations to track.

DE does not appear.  John O'Boyle appears for the State.  State relates 22TR255 is to track with 22CF54.  Hearing set to 3/31/2022 at 2:00 PM along with prelim in CF case.
Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:12 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Samuel T Salter appeared by video, Attorney Tyler T Kongslien for Samuel T Salter appeared by video for today.
Covers 22CF54, 22TR247, 22TR248 and 22TR251
Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Next hearing to be in person. TRs continue to track.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Samuel T Salter appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow (for today) appeared by video for Samuel T Salter. 

Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender services.  The defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 
AIA set to insure defendant has counsel.  May appear either in person or by zoom video.

(bond and ms scanned to jail)
